summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from late June to early July 2020 discussing the planning, approval, and execution of an operation to locate and arrest a target (understood to be Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. The emails detail travel approvals, cost estimates, the use of technical assets to locate a phone, and the execution of a search warrant.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the target of the FBI operation; her phone's historical location data indicated she was in New Hampshire, prompting a shift in the operation's focus.

events.title: Travel approval request for arrest operation
events.description: An FBI agent requests approval for travel to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation, providing a cost estimate for the trip.

events.title: Shift in target location to New Hampshire
events.description: The operation shifts focus as historical phone data indicates the target (Maxwell) is in New Hampshire, requiring the movement of technical assets from Boston and Newark.

events.title: Travel approval granted and search warrant pending
events.description: Travel approval is granted with an EAN number. The team is waiting for a search warrant to be signed before executing the operation.

events.title: Search warrant execution and arrest
events.description: The search warrant is executed to find the target on a property. The target is reported as being in custody.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively planning an operation to arrest Ghislaine Maxwell in late June/early July 2020.
The operation's initial focus was Massachusetts, but shifted to New Hampshire based on historical data from Maxwell's phone.
The operation required moving technical assets from Boston and Newark to assist in locating Maxwell's phone.
A search warrant was executed to find Maxwell on a property, leading to her being taken into custody.
